text: I find it amusing all the people whining that this isn't as good as the original. author: Zhaituki

text: @MasterZhaituki Yeah, they really did change quite a bit, and I wish they kept it 3 laps, or at least made it 2 laps like Wario Colosseum, but still, the track is really pretty and they did a good job modernizing it. I see this more of an evolution of the N64 Rainbow Road, rather than a true retro track, like the other ones they've done. Maybe they'll remake it again in a future MK and have both the evolution and an updated version of N64 RR, like if they made two sets of tracks, a classic set like MKDD and before, and futuristic tracks like MK8 and after. They probably won't have the memory capacity to do that for a couple generations, but that would make for a really interesting lineup of tracks in, say, MK11.
author: Yoshi Darkice

text:
@Devin Graves OR...

They could've done this:

50cc: 3 sections
100cc: 2 laps
150cc and Mirror: 3 laps

text: The Wii U bundle with this game should be enough for me to buy the console, though I do wonder if I should wait a bit and see what Nintendo does at E3. It's not like I don't already have tons of games in my backlog! I briefly listened to this game's soundtrack and find it alright, but not outstanding (though the live instruments are top notch). It'll probably have to grow on me. Some of the remixes like this one are quite awesome, sticking close to the original while adding just enough new elements and, of course, the much better sound quality.
